title: Vodka Pan Pizza
description: Experience a delightful twist on classic margherita pizza with this Vodka Pan Pizza, featuring rich vodka sauce, fresh mozzarella, and vibrant grape tomatoes. Ready in just over half an hour, this homemade pizza offers restaurant-quality flavors faster than delivery, perfect for a cozy dinner at home.
ingredients: 3 basil leaves, sliced into thin ribbons
instructions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Lightly grease a 12-inch cake pan.
Stretch and roll out the pizza dough and place it in the prepared pan. Prick the dough with a fork.
Bake the pizza dough in the preheated oven for 5 minutes.
Remove the pizza from the oven and spread vodka sauce evenly over the dough, leaving a 1/2 inch border around the edges.
Arrange mozzarella slices evenly over the sauce and sprinkle with shredded Parmesan cheese.
Remove the pizza and scatter the halved grape tomatoes on top.
Bake until the crust is golden and the tomatoes are slightly softened, about 5 more minutes.
Remove from oven and garnish with sliced basil leaves.
If desired, mix garlic granules into olive oil and brush along the exposed crust edges.
Cut into 8 to 10 slices and serve immediately.
tips: For a thinner crust, divide the dough into two 8-ounce portions. Use a high-quality vodka sauce like Rao’s for the best flavor. If using a convection oven or air fryer, watch cooking times closely as they may vary. Brushing garlic-infused olive oil on the crust adds a delicious aromatic finish.

structured_content.content: This Vodka Pan Pizza transforms the familiar margherita into a vibrant, flavorful experience with the addition of creamy vodka sauce and fresh ingredients. The crispy golden crust and melty mozzarella create a perfect harmony of textures and tastes that will make your kitchen smell irresistible.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Quick and easy to make in under 35 minutes
  • Restaurant-quality flavors at home
  • Perfect for weeknight dinners or casual entertaining
  • Uses simple, store-bought ingredients for convenience
  • Customizable with optional garlic oil for extra flavor

structured_content.content: I remember the first time I made this pizza on a busy weeknight—it was a game changer. The vodka sauce added a subtle richness that elevated the whole dish, and the fresh basil brought it all together. It quickly became a family favorite that we love sharing with friends.

• Main ingredient: Prepared pizza dough works best for ease and consistent texture; Aldi’s dough is a great budget-friendly option.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Vodka sauce adds a creamy, tangy depth, while fresh basil and garlic granules provide aromatic highlights.
  • Supporting ingredients: Fresh mozzarella melts beautifully for a creamy texture; grape tomatoes add juicy bursts of color and freshness; Parmesan adds a salty finish.
  • Equipment needed: A 12-inch cake pan for the pan pizza style, a fork for docking the dough, and an oven preheated to 425°F for perfect baking.

Preparation:
Preheat your oven to 425°F and lightly grease your pan. Roll out the dough evenly and dock it with a fork to prevent bubbles.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Bake the dough alone for 5 minutes to set the crust. Then spread vodka sauce, layer mozzarella and Parmesan, and bake for 15 minutes. Add grape tomatoes and bake another 5 minutes until crust is golden and tomatoes soften.
Finishing Touches:
Garnish with fresh basil ribbons. For an extra flavor boost, brush the crust edges with garlic-infused olive oil. Slice and serve hot for the best experience.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Pre-baking the dough ensures a crisp crust that won’t get soggy.
  • Avoid overloading the pizza with sauce or toppings to keep the crust crisp.
  • Look for a golden crust and bubbly cheese as signs it's perfectly baked.
  • Store leftovers in an airtight container and reheat in the oven for best texture.

structured_content.content: Sharing this pizza with family always brings joy—its comforting flavors and fresh ingredients make every bite memorable. It’s a dish that invites conversation and laughter around the table.

Try adding a sprinkle of red pepper flakes for a spicy kick, or fresh oregano for an herbal twist. A drizzle of balsamic glaze after baking can add a sweet tangy contrast. For a smoky flavor, consider a few slices of roasted red pepper or smoked mozzarella.
Pair this pizza with a crisp green salad and a chilled glass of white wine or sparkling water with lemon. It’s perfect for casual dinners, weekend gatherings, or a fun pizza night with friends.

For a gluten-free option, use gluten-free pizza dough. Vegans can substitute mozzarella with plant-based cheese and skip Parmesan or use a vegan alternative. Add roasted vegetables or vegan sausage to customize toppings while keeping the spirit of the dish.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Use room temperature dough for easier stretching and better texture.
  • Let mozzarella slices drain on paper towels to prevent excess moisture.
  • Brush garlic oil on the crust right after baking for a fragrant finish.
  • Slice pizza with a sharp pizza cutter for clean, even pieces.

structured_content.content: With this recipe in your kitchen arsenal, you’ll feel confident creating a delicious, impressive pizza that delights everyone. Enjoy the process and savor every flavorful bite!
